strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Spring Ball Bounce (Left to Right)
strats.note: At max non-speed run speed, you can bounce on both platforms and avoid all acid.

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Frozen Rinka (Left ro Right)
note: Doable using the far left Rinka to cross.
Alternatively, it can also just be used to setup an angle with the Rinka near the left edge of the pool.

to.note: FIXME don't we need Metroid avoidance strats too, like in Metroid rooms 3 and 4?

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Spring Ball Bounce (Right to Left)
note: At max non-speed run speed, you can bounce on both platforms and avoid all acid.
This even avoids the third Metroid.

strats.name: Metroid Room 1 Frozen Rinka (Right to Left)
strats.note: Doable using the top Rinka near the right end of the acid pool.

to.note: All strats here are to get through without killing the Metroids, since left door is unlocked.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Taking a rinka hit stops the Metroid damage for a while and is less damage.

to.note: All strats here are to get through without killing the Metroids, since left door is unlocked.
Taking the damage is deemed the only strat if we assume you don't know you're entering that room.

nodes.name: Left Door
nodes.note: Door is unlocked even if you don't touch the Dust Torizo

to.note: FIXME Be able to represent that you go down to 1 energy (or do baby skip). It doesn't seem to be based on a game flag per se, so it might happen every time you enter from the right?

runways.note: This will need a resetRoom that avoids an obstacle for beamless, because PBs coming up will break the blocks this needs
This will need a resetRoom that avoids an obstacle for beamless, because PBs coming up will break the blocks this needs
This will need a resetRoom that avoids an obstacle for beamless, because PBs coming in from 2 or 3 will break the blocks this needs

rooms.name: Mother Brain Room
rooms.note: FIXME Maybe we can split MB into several events to properly indicate the ammo requirements?

nodes.name: Mother Brain
nodes.note: The requirements for finishing MB1 is in the 3 to 4 link.

unlockStrats.name: Base
unlockStrats.note: The fight also brings Samus down below 100 energy, but then it fills her up

to.note: Glass takes 18 hits of any missile and must be killed to win the fight while MB1 itself requires 3000 hp worth of ammo after the initial 6 hits opens the hole. Hitting MB also damages glass.
This door appears only after Mother Brain is defeated. Because Mother Brain 3 requires practically nothing events move directly from MB2 to defeat

strats.note: Would be a notable strat, but it already has its own tech.

to.note: Direct link to MB1 for the Morph Zebetite skip

nodes.name: Right Doorway
nodes.note: It's really just a wall. You can't go back.
